reviews.review: One of the Best games i have ever played and will replay over and over again. The Co-op is really fun.

I love this game and it is my favorite two-player Valve Video Game!!! I would rather they make another single-playe/ muti-player Portal, or single-player Half-Life, than make a two-player only Left 4 Dead.

Portal 2 mostra como uma arma de portais pode f*der sua cabeça.

Prós:
- Uma excellente história. Ele até pode ser um pouco curto, mas mesmo assim você vai demorar um bom tempinho pra resolver esses puzzles.
- Os personagens são muito bem-humorados e muito bacans (menos com quem vc joga, que nao fala palavra nenhuma em nenhum momento, nem mesmo quando você morre)
- Vários levels diferentes com novas coisas à se fazer, com novos utensílios e melhorias de portal.
- Uma Workshop muito bacana. Crie seu level e faça share dele. Jogue os levels dos outros também.
- O bom e velho co-op antigo. Muito legal a interação dos dois robôs e as zueras deles heuheu.
- Várias conquistats e várias coisas à se fazer além de "jogar"

Contras: 
- Se você tiver um contra, vai se f*der

Nota: 10,5/10
Tão Bom que nem posso dar 10.
Excelente game

[h1] Portal 2, c'est : [/h1]

-> Un jeu incontournable de Steam, et sûrement l'un des jeux les plus populaires du jeu vidéo,
-> Un style de jeu unique basé sur la réflexion et la logique,
-> Une histoire très bien réalisée, avec beaucoup d'humour et de rebondissements,
-> Des personnages connus de tous et charismatiques,
-> Un mode solo pour les explorateurs et un mode coop pour se trifouiller les méninges à deux,
-> Un créateur de cartes simple à comprendre et la possibilité de partager la carte en publique,
-> Les commentaires des développeurs (en anglais S-T français) pour tout savoir sur la conception du jeu.

Bref, pourquoi hésiter ? Achetez ! [u] MAINTENANT !!! [/u] (Préférez acheter le pack Portal + Portal 2 pendant les soldes, pour bien comprendre l'histoire et faire des économies).

One of - if not - my favorite games. Bought the ps3 version when it came out and when I saw it was on sale for 75% I just thought I had to buy it. Great story and the level creator is fun to mess around with allthough it could be updated. Well worth it for the price.

One of the games that will always speak to me no matter what other games are around. I will be around someday thinking about how funny and well written this game was and how beautiful the game is and defines my defininition of an amazing experience. What a legendary part of my gaming life, the pinnacle and precipice of enjoyment, lovingly forever sitting here in my library.  I will never incinerate you WCC, I love you. 10/10 Life Changing game.
why are you reading reviews, just buy it!

Portal Two? More like Portal POO.

10/10 would love again

Definitely a must buy. Portal 2 is a wonderful puzzle game with a funny and heartwarming story.
In Portal 2 you learn more about Aperture Science in the past. And it's not like those mostly dull CW TV shows where you learn more about superheroes when they started. It is actually interesting because you learn more about GlaDOS herself (who she is and why she is insane). It is impossible to play this game without smiling from laughter as GlaDOS and the hilariously stupid Wheatley attempt to kill you. You will want to stop progressing through the game just to hear Wheatley try to "hack" a machine. Most of the time if you wait enough Wheatley will continue attempting to figure out how to get out of a certain situation. For example you will hear his hacking techniques where he makes a list of the objects in a locked room including a computer, the floor, and objects not in the room like pens.

Portal 2 has levels but there are parts of the game where you get out of the test room number i formula and explore the back of the facility in search of a way out. The test rooms themselves are very accessible. To test a hypothesis you don't have to do alot of work, where in other FPSes with puzzle elements you would have to backtrack the whole level to find one stupid cracked wall that looks different from other ones that you have to shoot. They also give you alot of hints in the design of the level. It's kind of hard to describe but the design of the levels (like railings on certain platforms or black spaces on certain places) scratches off some theories with wrong answers on how to solve some of the puzzles.

There is also coop but I have not played it yet. I have looked at the level editor and the great thing about it is that you cannot submit a level unless there is a solution. That definitely means that all the levels in the workshop are genuine.

This is a game that everyone can play and would want to play to the end. I wish Valve would make single player games again. Definitely get it and play it!
It's a realy good game! play it!

This game took what made Portal so awesome and nearly perfected it. Even better humor, still with a nice twist of sarcasm and darkness. The story is expanded upon very much, including the backstory to Aperture, GlaDos, and possibly Chell, according to some (kind of absurd) theories. Added mechanics which work nicely in sync with portals, a few fairly predictable plot twists, and an epic (at least compared to the lack of action in the game) final battle. Not to mention the turret opera and "Want you gone" which I have already rewatched about six times, this game is truly amazing and anybody should definitely play it.
This is a good stragy/skill game, and a Great storryline and characters. Over all a great game. I like the co-op mode and how you can play it online and splitscreen.
This game is awesome! Best Game Ever!!!! Awesome Storyline and sequil to Portal.
Very fun and funny game. Anyone not already familiar the franchise should definitely give it a shot.

It's freakin portal. Enough said.

As a game, this comes close to perfection. The soundtrack is great. The surroundings are great. The characters are great, including the voice-acting. The story is brilliant and well built-up. The nicely hidden easter-eggs that connect Portal to Half-Life. Controls are easy and the puzzles go from easy to not too hard to be annoying.

And that's just the single player. The Multiplayer just adds to the game, which is something -in my honest opinion- that a lot of games do very, very wrong. The puzzles are, yet again, fun to go through. And if your friend/fellow traveler is cooperative and constructive, it gets even more fun. 

But wait! There's more!
The multiplayer is even a continuation of the Singleplayer. Picking up somewhere after the singleplayer story, it builds on.
There's even a good replayability, also not present in a lot of games.

My son loves watching me, my wife or both of us play portal. He knows GlaDos, He knows Wheatley. He knows Atlas & Peabody. And, since he's five and loves the game and how it works & looks, I can't possibly think of a better way to end this review by saying: He would love another Portal-game. And Half-Life 3... that would be nice as well, while you're at it, Valve.

Cara Mia Addio

Italiano:

Cara bella, cara mia bella!
Mia bambina, o ciel! [pun: Chell = It. "Ciel" = Sky"]
Ché la stimo...
Ché la stimo.
O cara mia, addio!

La mia bambina cara,
perché non passi lontana?
Sì, lontana da Scïenza, [personified]
Cara, cara mia bambina?
Ah, mia bella!
Ah, mia cara!
Ah, mia cara!
Ah, mia bambina!
O cara, cara mia...


English:

Dear beautiful, my beautiful darling! My child, oh Chell! [pun: "oh heavens!"]
For I hold her in esteem...
For I hold her in esteem.
Farewell to my dear!

My dear girl,
why do you not walk away?
Yes, away from Science,
My dear, my dear girl?
Ah, my beautiful!
Ah, my dear!
Ah, my dear!
Ah, my child!
Oh dear, my dear...

Сюжет в игре на первый взгляд довольно простой: с самого начала мы встречаем модуль Уитли, который хочет помочь Челл подняться на поверхность. Казалось бы, тут игру уже можно и заканчивать, но не тут то было — череда особых обстоятельств завязывает интригу, которая на протяжении всей игры, не отпустит вас ни на секунду.

I still have plenty of portal hours that I need to lose myself in so I think I'm going to do that right now.

"If you liked Portal, you'll like this".

Whilst the original Portal was a couple of hours of clever, witty writing.. almost like something that was done in a developer's spare time and tacked on as an easter egg, Portal 2 is an attempt to make an entire game based around the same concept.

Does it work? Kind of. The dark humour of the original is still present, but rather than being a short campaign of concentrated excellence in the form of a puzzle game, Portal 2 is more of a typical adventure game with occasional flashes of brilliance. This isn't to say that Portal 2 isn't as funny as the original, but it's a far more laid-back story with more going on in the form of back story and hidden nuggets of insight. It would have been impossible to keep up that level of intensity for the entire duration of Portal 2, so it's a wise choice.

Portal 2 is excellent, especially if you like Valve's typical dark sense of humour with quirky characters with questionable morals. It's far prettier than the original, and the dynamic music really adds to the atmosphere.

The biggest problem Portal 2 has is that the story and the game rarely meet. You can bet that if there's a section with exposition and narration, there won't be any puzzles for a while - there are very, very few parts where you have the two things together. This is an obvious decision as players would want the occasional breather between bouts of puzzles, and the pacing works well because of it. Although for me it did slow down quite a lot once you enter the salt mine, and didn't pick up until the first enrichment sphere...

It's still an absolute delight to play though, and well worth your time.

I can't comment on the multiplayer aspect as I don't play multiplayer, but the single player campaign is excellent.
